definitions.example: A job half done is hardly done at all.

definitions.definition: An economic role for which a person is paid.
definitions.example: He's been out of a job since being made redundant in January.
He had had a nose job.

definitions.definition: A task, or series of tasks, carried out in batch mode (especially on a mainframe computer).
A sudden thrust or stab; a jab.
A public transaction done for private profit; something performed ostensibly as a part of official duty, but really for private gain; a corrupt official business.
Any affair or event which affects one, whether fortunately or unfortunately.
A thing (often used in a vague way to refer to something whose name one cannot recall).
definitions.example: Pass me that little job with the screw thread on it.

definitions.definition: To do odd jobs or occasional work for hire.
To buy and sell for profit, as securities; to speculate in.
(often with out) To subcontract a project or delivery in small portions to a number of contractors.
definitions.example: We wanted to sell a turnkey plant, but they jobbed out the contract to small firms.

definitions.definition: To seek private gain under pretence of public service; to turn public matters to private advantage.
To strike or stab with a pointed instrument.
To thrust in, as a pointed instrument.
To hire or let in periods of service.
